attributes.additional_details:
No "Brexit bill" without audited accounts. 

The EU claims that the UK should pay a "Brexit bill" for leaving and has mentioned up to EUR 60bn as being due for ongoing liabilities. However, since the EU accounts have not been certified by the Court of Auditors for years, how can we know know what a correct figure should be. 

We call upon the government to refuse to discuss any payment for Brexit until the EU produces properly audited accounts.
attributes.background:
The EU accounts have not been certified by the Court of Auditors for years, how can we know what the correct figure should be, should we pay a 'Brexit bill'.
We call upon the government to refuse to discuss any payment for Brexit until the EU produces properly audited accounts.

rejection.details:
The EU accounts have been signed off by the auditors every year since 2007, so we're not sure what action you'd like the Government to take. 

You can find out more about this here:

http://www.eca.europa.eu/en/Pages/AR2015.aspx
